title: MarketplaceRestriction
description: A term definition that collects all attributes, which specifies restrictions on a product offering for whole marketplaces.
$comment: The enforcement of this term should ideally be done by the source marketplace before the offering gets replicated to another marketplace.

permittedOperator.description: A list of marketplaces that are exclusively permitted to publish this offering. If no marketplace is specified, the offering is generally permitted everywhere, except when there are specifically prohibited marketplaces.
permittedOperator.$comment: The identifier of the destination marketplace for the replication should be used for comparison.

prohibitedOperator.description: A list of all marketplaces that are specifically prohibited to publish this offering.
prohibitedOperator.$comment: The identifier of the destination marketplace for the replication should be used for comparison.

permittedLegalRegion.description: A list of well defined regions, e.g. countries, where only those marketplace that fall under legal jurisdiction of that region as permitted to publish the offering. If no region is specified, the offering is generally permitted everywhere, except when there are specifically prohibited regions.
permittedLegalRegion.$comment: The supplied legal region of the destination marketplace should be used for comparison. This could also mean matching a sub-region of this property. Every marketplace that does not supply its legal region is per se prohibited.

prohibitedLegalRegion.description: A list of well defined regions, e.g. countries, where every marketplace that falls under legal jurisdiction of that region as prohibited to publish the offering.
prohibitedLegalRegion.$comment: The supplied legal region of the destination marketplace should be used for comparison. This could also mean matching a sub-region of this property. Every marketplace that does not supply its legal region is per se prohibited.
